channel.title: Whats the rs clients document base?
channel.description:
whats the page which has the <applet> tags?
a while ago it was changed, if i wanted to connect to the prefix 'sl2' it used to be something like this [code]http://sl2.runescape.com/lang/en/aff/runescape/game.ws?lowmem=1&plugin=2[/code]
whats the current one where you can open a URLConnection and get the page source? more importantly, how did you find out? you used to be able to find it with firefox 'View Frame Info', but that doesnt work anymore
another way of asking this question is, when a legit client call getDocumentBase(), which URL does it get?

item.title: Whats the rs clients document base?
item.dc:creator: @ilyaostr9 io9
item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

[quote=“1337h4x, post:17, topic:73351”][quote author=yakman link=topic=107808.msg1085129#msg1085129 date=1175616731]

Also ROFL at you not knowing the most basic html hacking.

if you know so much, why dont you prove it? answer my question, show the client jar
i dont know enough html or whatever to get this, apparantly its javascript now, im not ashamed to admit it, i know scar and java, thats it
and you think just because you know this ‘html hacking’ you’re the dogs bollocks?

i came here to ask a question, not to take that abuse with you claiming you know so much, who do you are?!, if this was real life, id spit in your face

@mopar, i didnt acctualy change cherokee, i was just showing where the exception was thrown, in fact ill edit that post, it was a little confusing
[/quote]

fine. Go to the runescape page where the client is shown.

Right click -> view source.

Search for applet. Somewhere in the tags it should have “runescape.jar”. Voila, now you know the name of the jar.

Now right click on the whole page and select properties. Copy the page base or whatever (ch1.runescape.com/il2etc)

Remove the part behind .com/ and instead put the name of the file (runescape.jar)

You should have “ch1.runescape.com/runescape.jar” in the address bar now.

Press enter.[/quote]
I already gave him the secret hax for it and got blah++.

Read full topic
item.source: Whats the rs clients document base?

[/quote]

if you know so much, why dont you prove it? answer my question, show the client jar
i dont know enough html or whatever to get this, apparantly its javascript now, im not ashamed to admit it, i know scar and java, thats it
and you think just because you know this ‘html hacking’ you’re the dogs bollocks?

i came here to ask a question, not to take that abuse with you claiming you know so much, who do you are?!, if this was real life, id spit in your face

@mopar, i didnt acctualy change cherokee, i was just showing where the exception was thrown, in fact ill edit that post, it was a little confusing[/quote]

fine. Go to the runescape page where the client is shown.

Right click -> view source.

Search for applet. Somewhere in the tags it should have “runescape.jar”. Voila, now you know the name of the jar.

Now right click on the whole page and select properties. Copy the page base or whatever (ch1.runescape.com/il2etc)

Remove the part behind .com/ and instead put the name of the file (runescape.jar)

You should have “ch1.runescape.com/runescape.jar” in the address bar now.

Press enter.

item.source: Whats the rs clients document base?

item.title: Whats the rs clients document base?
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

didnt work for

this is the exception thrown

Exception in thread "main" hb
        at mc.a(Unknown Source)
        at client.init(Unknown Source)
        at com.cherokee.Cherokee.<init>(Cherokee.java:103)
        at com.cherokee.Cherokee.main(Cherokee.java:48)
public Cherokee(String[] args) {
	//..

        initUI();
        setup.getAppletInstance().init();  <-- exception is thrown here
    }

this is what i changed

    private void setAppletProperties() throws IOException {
        Cherokee._instance.setProperty("width", "765");
        Cherokee._instance.setProperty("height", "503");

	String[] names= {"members","modewhat","modewhere","lowmem","lang"};
	String[] values= {"0","0","0","1","0"};

	for(int f=0;f<names.length;f++)
		Cherokee._instance.setProperty(names[f], values[f]);
	//..
	

    public RS2Setup() {
        try {
            setAppletProperties();
	    jarName= "runescape.jar";
	    mainClass= "client";
            URLClassLoader loader = new URLClassLoader(new URL[]{new URL(Cherokee._instance.getCodeBase().toString() + "/" + jarName)});
	//..

Read full topic

item.title: Whats the rs clients document base?
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

yes, the conf file,

well now the html tags are made by javascript, since the update, i dont even know the name of the jar file.

its a bit annoying because i just read up on reflection, and i think i could make the accessor methods,
btw, the Component in the current deob (453 i think?) which has all the listeners added to it, is Class70_Sub1.aCanvas2449

i think the RS2Setup file could be rewritten where you just have a final String with the jar name and main class, so anyone know how to get the name of the jar?

Read full topic
item.source: Whats the rs clients document base?

item.title: Whats the rs clients document base?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I parsed the parameters out with some code in RS2Setup.java, so depending on what they did it could be broken as well, the most code you would have to change is RS2Setup.java, I would assume you should just have to change the conf file.

Read full topic
item.source: Whats the rs clients document base?

item.title: Whats the rs clients document base?
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

[quote=“io9, post:3, topic:73351”][quote author=frank_ link=topic=107808.msg1080295#msg1080295 date=1175538808]
this frame > view frame info

http://au1.runescape.com/l1,p0,j1

wtf that all means i have no idea, but i dont imagine it would take too much to figure out
[/quote]
l1 - 1=lowmem
p0 - plugin - 0 default signed java
j1 - not a clue

Now, a javascript holds the

http:/WORLDPREFIXHERE.runescape.com/plugin.js?lowmem=1&plugin=0

^^ Self explanatory, tbh.[/quote]java type imo

Read full topic
item.source: Whats the rs clients document base?

item.title: Whats the rs clients document base?
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

javascript eh? thats kind of shit.

how do you make cherokee loads runescape?

this is the old config file

getCodeBase=http://sl2.runescape.com
getDocumentBase=http://sl2.runescape.com/lang/en/aff/runescape/game.ws?lowmem=1&plugin=2
Setup=com.cherokee.rs.rs2.RS2Setup

this doesnt work, and its probably that javascript thats messing it

getDocumentBase=http://sl2.runescape.com/l1,p2,j1

sometime tells me the source code is going to have to be changed

Read full topic
